radiographic_examinations.findings: One area of consolidation in the left lower lobe, another area in the right upper lobe, and a small left pleural effusion.
Diffuse air-space disease in the right upper lung zone and in the left lung except for the apex. A left pleural effusion was present.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: computed tomographic (CT) scan of the chest
radiographic_examinations.findings: A mass, 2 cm in diameter, in the right upper lobe, with air bronchograms; ground-glass opacification in the right upper and right lower lobes; air-space consolidation in the left lower lobe; and volume loss in both lower lobes.
Improvement in the air-space opacities and in the pleural effusion.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Decreased opacity in the left lower and right upper lung zones and a small, residual, left pleural effusion just before discharge.
